page.title: 04LEE MOOR CHINA CLAY-USES.
page.content: The china clay which is obtained from the Lee Moor area has many uses.Most of the china clay is used as a 'filler' for paper.What it does is to fill in the minute gaps between the paper fibres,to provide a good printing surface.Since china clay is often cheaper than wood pulp,it is not surprising that the paper industry is the largest user of china clay.Some magazines are about one-fifth clay. More than three-quarters of the china clay produced in the Lee Moor area is used in the making of paper.Some of the better quality clay is used in the manufacture of chinaware and porcelain products.Some of the clay is used in the manufacture of paints,to help it spread easily and smoothly.It is even used in the manufacture of medicines, cosmetics,toothpastes and soaps.The demand for this china clay is rising.
